column1: wide of the crease but this full and largely holding its line outside off, 139ks, Rahane presses forward and drives it through backward point
zipping through outside off to Wade. He grabs it in front of his head. Short, Cummins hits the deck hard and the ball flies through to the keeper
much fuller, angled in, and shapes away around off, Rohit's back foot moves across leg stump as he opens the face and runs the ball towards point
back of a length and skids through the channel again, left alone. Wade takes it beside his head again
and again! Cummins hits 140ks and hits the gloves of Wade. Shorter than the previous ball and seams away outside off. Rohit had let this pass too
back of a length, angled in, but the line is too straight, allowing Rohit to tuck it away to the right of midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Rahane meets the ball with an open face, and glides it to point
Coulter-Nile ventures wide of the crease again. This ball, though, holds its line outside off. Rahane opens the face and runs it to the same fielder
pitched up outside off, swings away a bit under overcast skies, Rahane presses forward, shelves the drive, and lets it go
length-ball awayswinger, starts just outside off and veers away, left alone again
short and wide outside off, 138ks, Rahane goes after it, upper-cutting the ball. But there is protection in the deep at third man
Coulter-Nile cranks up to 141ks, finds that gentle outswing again, Rohit isn't tempted. Excellent start from the two Australia quicks
tight line on off, no lateral movement now, Rahane stretches out and smoothly pushes to cover
good length and angling in on off, Rahane presses forward and pats the ball down to mid-on
good length - and not a half-volley - outside off, Rahane presses forward, drives on the up, and finds the gap at the covers
short of a good length and skidding in towards middle and leg, 144ks, Rahane leaps off his feet and fends the ball to leg
The direction is wrong from Cummins. He spears a back-of-a-length delivery down the leg side. Left alone
Rahane loves the ball coming into the bat. He late-cuts it from outside off to the left of backward point
short ball outside off, 140ks, think this one got stuck in the surface. Rohit shapes to pull but ends up  short-arm flapping in the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Rohit gets only two
pitched up and slanted in on off, nearly 140ks, played back to the bowler off the front foot
full and on off, Rahane twirls his wrists and works it to mid-on pressing forward. Cummins' front foot had strayed. No-ball
there's the bouncer, defeats Rahane's hook. Banged in outside off, beats Rahane for pace, and slams the gloves of Wade. One for the over, says umpire Erasmus

Australia find reward for their tight lines and lengths with the new ball. Coulter-Nile puts it on a length and wide outside off, swings away further - it ended on a set of stumps outside off. Rahane throws his bat at a drive and only snicks it behind. Wade, who has been busy this afternoon, moves to his right and snags the catch. Rahane falls for 5 off 15 balls on return
very, very full and wide outside off, just inside the tramline, asking Kohli to drive. The Indian captain says 'Nah, not now'
much fuller and closer to off stump. Dangled up in the channel, hint of away movement, Kohli reaches out for a biiiiig drive and watches the ball move past the outside edge
short, rising outside off. Kohli rises with it and drops the ball to cover
just short of a good length and outside off, opens the face and dabs to backward point
good length, angled in, straightens late, poked to cover via an outside edge
back of a length on off, defended cover off the back foot
on a length and outside off, run away to backward point
much fuller and outside off, Rohit checks his drive and finds mid-off

Smith falls to his right from second slip to track down this edge but can't cling on. He slaps the ground in frustration. Back of a length and zips through outside off at 147.3ks, Rohit looks to open the face and run it past the cordon. He gets away

Kohli can't get away. Maxwell at backward point pulls off a belting one-handed catch over his head. Kohli has been dismissed for a four-ball duck. This was full and wide - wider than a set of stumps outside off again. Kohli had left his first ball. He chased the second one with a big drive. The big drive comes out again, he slices it into the air. Maxwell propels himself at backward point, sticks out his right hand, and grabs the ball, and lands. Great reflexes from Maxwell
dug in short on off, 140.8ks, Pandey fends it off

Is Pandey out nicking behind as well? Australia are sure they have their man and keep celebrating... but umpire Erasmus asks them to hold on. Was it a bump ball? He refers it to the TV umpire. Very, very full and swinging away so very late outside off, Pandey jams his bat down on the ground. The ball did not touch the ground, though; takes the outside edge and floats into the gloves of Wade. Clean catch. India left at 11 for 3 in 5.3. All three batsmen out flirting in the channel
on a length outside off, swings away so very late, left alone. Past the tramline. Wide
overpitched and outside off, just too full,and Jadhav leans into a square-drive, drilling it to the left of backward point. First boundary for India
back of a length and outside off, defended

back of a length, starts on a fourth-stump line, and darts away. Jadhav is caught between playing and leaving. He does a bit of this, a bit of that, and watches the ball dribble past the leg stump off a fortunate inside edge
just short of a good length on off, opens the face and steers it wide of backward point
pitched up and outside off, presses forward and pushes it to cover
full and angling in on off stump, Jadhav does not have a big front-foot stride, but drives it between midwicket and mid-on for his and India's second boundary
really full on a sixth/seventh-stump line outside off, swings away late, Jadhav thrusts his hands out and is beaten past the outside edge
Australia's plan is to bowl full and wide outside off. Jadhav reaches out for the ball with his hands and flashes a drive to third man
chest-high short ball on middle, 150ks - pace like fire, rushes Rohit into a hook. He hits it in the air but the ball does not carry to Zampa at deep backward square leg
wide of the crease, holds its line outside off, Rohit plays with soft hands and dabs to backward point
very full and wide outside off, 139ks, Rohit throws his bat at a drive with his front foot nowhere close to the pitch of the ball. Toe-ended down to mid-off
pitched up and outside off, opens the face and dabs it to backward point
short, rising outside off, Rohit secures a single to third man with an upper cut
back of a length and angling into a front-foot defence on off
on a length and outside off, asks Jadhav to drive. He obliges, hits it on the up, but can't get it past mid-off

first boundary for Rohit after 20 balls. Loose ball - short and wide outside off - Rohit extends his hands as far as he could and slashes a cut to the right of backward point, beats the man in the deep to his left
back of a length on middle, turned to midwicket
back of a length on of, defended on the back foot
full and angling away outside off, presses forward and drives it to cover
an upppish flick from off stump, but placed to the right of mid-on
shortish on off, opens the face and glides it to short third man
back of a length and outside off, stands tall and punches crisply to cover
back of a length and outside off, Jadhav stylishly late-cuts to backward point
short and wide outside off, cracked straight to point
length ball on off, blocked off the front foot
banged short and outside off, cross-seamer, 138ks, rushes Jadhav into a hook. He ends up miscuing it in the air, straight of mid-on
pretty full and outside off, Jadhav walks into a drive and simply eases it through the covers. So easy on the eye, but just two for Jadhav
good length on off, gets forward, opens the face and runs it to point
pitched up and outside off, driven through the line to the right of the cover-point sweeper
on a length and outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
full and outside off, presses forward and pushes it to the covers

Jadhav races down the track, Faulkner drags his length back and cramps the batsman for room. He might have eked out an inside edge onto the pad. Faulkner's front foot is on the line - harsh call - no-ball
short, back-of-the-hand slower ball outside off, 115ks, dragged away to deep midwicket with a pull
fullish and outside off, opens the face and pats it to point
just short of a good length on off and middle, Rohit clips it away to the right of midwicket
full on a sixth-stump line outside off, the batsman reaches out and slices it to point
full and skids through on off, camps back and works it through the gap at midwicket
full and angling in on off, milked away to the right of mid-on now
really, really full and outside off, near yorker, the batsman squeezes a drive to mid-off
zippy short ball outside off, Jadhav pulls his bat inside the line, and lets it climb through to Wade
good length, slight tail down leg side. Thuds him on the pad as he looks to flick
short and angled towards the corridor. Not so much room. But he goes for the cut. And he deposits it backward of point to beat third man's slide to the right
back of a length outside off, poked to sweeper cover
good length, in at off stump. Reaches way in front to poke this back to the bowler
clean. Length at off stump again. He takes a small step down the track while getting the front leg out of the way to make room. Then he hits through the line, straight over the bowler
good length on middle stump, defended into the off side with an open face
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper off the toe of the bat
short and wide outside off, half-crouching as he drags this to deep square
full outside off, flicked to deep square's left
full outside off, guided down to third man
good length at off stump, poked on the up to sweeper cover
easy. Short in the corridor, stands tall and shovels it to fine leg
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
nice. Slow, dipping on off stump. Draws him forward and beats the outside edge
short on off stump, cut to sweeper
tossed up outside off, jammed out to sweeper off the front foot
short outside off, cut straight to point
back of a length at middle stump, spins away sharply as Rohit looks to make room on the back foot. Forced to push well away from his body, back towards the bowler
back of a length in the corridor, guided off the face to third man
full outside off, looks to clatter it through the covers but his weight was moving backwards. Can't get it through extra cover
back of a length outside off, stabs at it away from the body, beaten

flies past Maxwell's outstretched right hand. Ooooooo goes the crowd as they show the replay. Rohit slashed at this wide length ball and it was at a catchable height. Maxwell flew to his right but couldn't get a hand on it
good length at off stump, defended to extra cover

holes out to deep square leg. An ordinary shot. Stoinis has been easily picked off with short bowling. But this one is 5 kph quicker than the last ball. Rohit goes for the hook, but the ball is way outside off. It's a regulation top edge and a regulation reverse-cup for Coulter-Nile. Umpires check for no-ball, but the crowd has already begun shouting Dhoni! Dhoni!
a misfield and he's way! A slip was on place for Dhoni. This is back of a length and lifting away from outside off. He gets a thick outside edge and backward point lets it through
full outside off, poked to sweeper off the front foot
back of a length outside off, a slider, chopped to backward point
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket

do. not. bowl. short. to. him. A long-hop at middle stump. Kedar Jadhav is a murderer of spinners. Climbs into the like one. Slaps it flat towards the midwicket boundary. It lands just short of the rope
good length at off stump, defended to point
length in the corridor, pushes it wide of extra cover and takes off immediately
back of a length outside off, left alone
edged and four. Back of a length outside off, wafts at it away from his body and it flies wide of first slip
back of a length at off stump, defended pitchside off the back foot
short on at middle stump, swivels to pull to fine leg
back of a length at middle stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
full one at off stump. Jadhav steps out and yorks himself. Manages to keep it out though
full at off stump, driven down the long-off...to applause from the crowd
oh close. Full at middle stump. Yorks himself and gets inside the line. Just manages to get bat on it and squeeze it to short fine. He was reaching out in the end as this drifted
full toss outside off, driven to long-off's left. Cartwright slides to his left and keeps it to two
back of a length outside off, spinning away, left alone
good length, off stump, forward block
good length outside off, early on the forward press. Bat turns as he meets it, ball rolls down to mid-off
short one outside off, sways away from it
good length outside off, looks to whip this past mid-on on the up. Mistimes it. Dribbles to mid-on
nicely played. Doesn't lean in too much. This is still rising as he brings the bat down and taps it past extra cover on the front foot

glorious shot, but extra cover gets a hand this time. Fuller and outside off. He leans into it this time and times it perfectly. The fieder sticks out his right arm as he dives and makes life easy for mid-off who might have had to run to fetch that
short and down leg side, doesn't go after it
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length, spins and bounces outside off. Watchfully dabs it to short third man
tossed up outside off, slices it uppishly to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off. Doesn't let it bounce. Down the track, tapped on the full to long-off
good length at off stump, gap between bat and pad as he defends. Not an issues against the legspinner
quicker one, pushed flat on a length at the pads. Hurriedly flicked to midwicket

is that a drop? Sounded like it. A full, dipping ball outside off. Jadhav goes for the slog sweep and heaves hard. Seems to be an under-edge as this zips into Wade's pads and deflects towards short fine
full outside off, swinging away. Dhoni leans in for the cover drive and he's beaten

nearly run-out. Dhoni is furious. He pokes this length ball to extra cover's left and takes off. Halfway down the track, he's told to go back by his partner who hasn't moved. He slips and nearly falls. Stranded, he watches as the fielder can't hit the stumps direct

caught at midwicket. Short one at off stump. Once again, a batsman looks to drag Stoinis' short one into the leg side. Once again, slow on it. This one is bunted off the high part of the bat. An easy catch
back of a length into the pads, dabbed to fine leg with soft hands...and they come back for the second.
bouncer. Tempted to go after it outside off, but he decides against it. Wasn't very convincing but that was well above him and he gets away
good length outside off, defended to point with an open face
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, hammered to sweeper cover off the back foot
full at leg stump, aerially driven, down to long-on
back of a length outside off, punched wide of long-off off the back foot. And there won't be running issues with these two. Back for the second, easily
full outside off, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
back of a length outside off, slapped to sweeper's right off the back foot
good length at off stump, looks to poke it through the covers. Can't get his wrists to move quickly enough. It's back at the bowler
good length outside off, defended into the covers

shot. But superbly fielded. This was coming in at middle stump, handsomely pushed past the non-striker. It's running away to the long-on boundary but Warner has hared across from mid-off. Puts in a huge dive to pull it back
full outside off, hard hands as he looks to drive through the line. No feet at all. Aerial for a moment, straight to mid-off
full in the corridor, slight shape away and then a big seam movement away. Once again, hard hands and no feet as he looks to drive. Beaten

what a shot. Come to me, he says. I'm not going to hit you. The ball, dug into the pitch and rising in the corridor, is lured. It's coming into him, cutting out the angle for any shot. Then, at the last moment, Pandya springs a surprise. A bat, shaped like a ramp, deflects this over slip. Subtle, unlike his haircut
good length outside off, defended into the covers
back of a length at leg stump, tickled wide of short fine leg
back of a length at off stump, dabbed to point with an open face
back of a length at leg stump, defended back down the pitch
offcutter, back of a length at leg stump. Feathers it in front of midwicket with a closed face, and they take off
full outside off, tapped to extra cover off the front foot
good length outside off, defended towards mid-off
back of a length outside off, watches it on and thumps it gracefully past extra cover on the up. Sweeper cleans up
good length outside off, skews the cover drive off the outside edge, aerially, to sweeper cover
good length outside off, steps out and pokes it to extra cover
nice juicy, wide full toss. Deflected straight to backward point. Who throws at Pandya's stumps at the non-strikers end. The heat always shows up in Chennai
good length outside off, defended into the off side
full, swinging away wide outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, chopped to third man off the under edge as he looks to cut
good length outside off, poked to extra cover off the toe-end
back of a length at off stump, flicked to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length outside off, uses his wrists to dab it to the open square leg region
offcutter, back of a length outside off, deflected to third man
back of a length at off stump, tapped into the point region
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side

goes through Smith at slip. An aimless stab in the corridor from Pandya. A nothing shot. It's headed straight to Smith but he sees the open face and starts moving to his right. Means he is already up as this flies low to his left. Would've taken it if he wasn't moving
full at leg stump, flicked to fine leg's left
good shot, but there is that straight mid-off. Nicely timed straight drive to this fuller delivery, but mid-off quickly down to his right
back of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man

short ball, doesn't quite come on. He watches it closely and pulls it to fine leg along the floor. There's been a third-umpire referral here. It's a direct hit from the deep. Pandya plonks his bat..and that prompts the referral. He was well in.
offcutter, good length at off stump. Defended to extra cover
back of a length outside off, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, looks to drop it into the off side with soft hands for a single. Maxwell swoops down on it, no run
back of a length at off stump, turned to midwicket off the back foot
good length outside off, defended to point off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length, Coulter-Nile hits a hard length and does not give room. Blocked on off
141ks shoulder-high short ball outside off, Pandya is beaten for pace as he attempts a hook. Top-edges the ball... but it does not carry to deep square leg
really full and wide outside off, Dhoni carves it away to deep point, opening the face of the bat
dug in short on the leg stump, heading towards his left shoulder, Pandya helps it away fine of long leg
back of a length and outside off, keeps a bit low, Dhoni jumps and jabs the ball into the covers
nice and full outside off, Dhoni responds with a crunch to mid-off
Pandya hares down the track and makes room outside leg, the bowler goes short on middle, scythed away towards deep point
short and width, carved away to square-ish third man
Dhoni pre-meditates a paddle sweep, Faulkner digs it short and slants it away outside off, hits the thigh outside the line
Dhoni stands up to this short ball outside off - this is right in his comfort zone. Punched strongly through the covers
back of a length on leg stump, Pandya has no room to free his arms, jabbed to midwicket
tight line on off, Pandya defensively plays to cover
Even bowler the bowler delivers, Dhoni shuffles across the off stump, then steps down the track, misses a hook. He cops a blow on his shoulder
Pandya now advances down the track, hits a short ball from outside off to mid-off

back of a length and skids low outside off, not sure if that was the offcutter, Pandya swings for the hills and does not make contact. The ball dies in front of Wade, bad bounce, and it beats him to the boundary. Indeed, it was the quickish offcutter
shortish and outside off, steered down to third man
back of a length and outside off, a solid punch to deep point ensues
slower offcutter, 108ks, kicks up at Pandya. He adjusts to it and ramps it to third man
really full on leg stump, driven powerfully to long-on
looped up on off, Dhoni push-drives a single down to long-off
middle-stump yorker, Pandya can't get under it. Hacks it down to long-on
straight ball on middle, Dhoni stretches out and taps a single down to long-off
tossed-up legbreak outside off, Pandya clears his front leg and swishes it down to long-off
back of a length and skids on off, faster one, Dhoni punches off the back foot to the sweeper on the off side
back of a length and outside off, Dhoni uses the pace of Stoinis to his advantage and directs it down to third man
slower ball outside off, 115ks, Pandya waits for the ball to arrive, then dabs it behind point
very full on off stump, 20ks faster than the previous ball, Dhoni's wrists send the ball to deep midwicket
slower offcutter, 111ks, Pandya is already through with the pull and is hit on the shoulder. Deceived by the lack of pace
slower, short ball outside off, 105ks, Pandya spots this change-up and swats it away to deep square leg
length-ball offcutter outside off, 108ks, Dhoni runs it to backward point, where the fielder makes a tumbling save
skidder, fizzes off the pitch and heads towards off stump, Pandya brings his bat down in the nick of time and chops to point
really full on the leg stump, slapped down to long-on
length ball, starts on middle and breaks away, pushed off the back foot to the covers
Dhoni advances down the track and yorks himself, jabbed back to Zampa
Dhoni uses his feet again, this time he drives a full ball from just outside off to long-off
straight in line, 96ks, this non-turner is worked in the gap at square leg
full and outside off, driven through the line through cover
Dhoni rises with this rising, short ball outside off and defensively punches to cover
very full and very wide outside off, Dhoni plays a long way away from the body. Flashes an inside edge. Wade dives full-length to his left and makes a half save
back of a length and hurries on outside off, 145ks, Pandya is late onto it, skewing it to cover
rapid length ball, defended on off
back of a length and angling in on off, nearly 140ks, Pandya pokes it out in the direction of point
short legbreak outside off, Dhoni pulls against the turn to long-on
full-toss on middle stump, Pandya sends it clattering over a dead-straight mid-on. Clears Faulkner
Pandya tees off! Tossed up on middle, Pandya loves the flight. He gets under it and hoists it down the ground. The ball soars over long-off. Whoa! That hit the roof

Bang! bang! bang! A hat-trick of boundaries. Pandya clears long-on and brings up his fifty off 48 balls. Floated up on middle, Pandya unleases the smoothest of swings and sends the ball over the boundary
Quicker and flatter on middle, it does not matter. Pandya still clears his front leg and clouts it straight of long-on who is in the deep now
full and outside off, slapped through the off side
too straight in line, worked away to midwicket
banged in short on leg stump, cramps Dhoni for room, flapped away behind square on the leg side
short and down the leg side, 140ks. Pace is your friend. Pace is your enemy. Pandya uses the pace of Cummins to his advantage and helps it fine on the leg side for another boundary
just short of a good length on off, blocked
much fuller and just a shade outside off, 142ks, Pandya answers with a dead-bat defence
shortish and outside off, tapped to point
Faulkner rolls his fingers across a full one outside off, lashed to long-off
overpitched and outside off, drilled to the covers
back of a length on off, glided down to third man
very full and outside off, slower cutter, Dhoni dabs it through point and scampers across to the other end

slower, short ball outside off, from the back of the hand, just 110ks. Pandya reads the change-up. He manufactures all the pace and smacks it away past the right of midwicket. Incredible hitting from the allrounder
full and outside off, flayed to long-off

Fetch that! Pandya thumps it over wide long-on. Slower offcutter outside off, 111.8ks, Pandya reads it, gets under it and sends the ball sailing into the stands. Stable base. Clean bat swing. Beautiful to watch
126ks offcutter, tapped down the ground for one
full and wide outside off, Dhoni reaches out for the ball and slices it down to third man
very full and wide outside off, drilled through the line for one
too full and outside off, Dhoni pushes it to the right of sweeper
length ball on off, opens the face, and manipulates behind point for one. India have plundered 50 off the last four overs
Dhoni uses his feet and pats it through midwicket. Pandya decides against the second
slider on middle, hit back to Zampa
Zampa flights it up on the middle stump, asks Pandya to go for it. And he holds nothing back. He clears his front leg and smites it over the wide long-on boundary. He hits the roof again
middle-stump yorker, dug out

Zampa has his revenge. Pushed through flatter and faster on middle, 92ks, no flight at all. Pandya goes low for a slog-sweep against the break, aiming wide long-on again. All he can manage now is a top edge that swirls to short third man. Ends a crackling innings - one that has given India a fighting chance. He goes for a career-best 83
straight ball on middle, defended
picked off the pads to deep square leg
short of a length on off, Bhuvneshwar hops and pats it to point
banged in short on off, Bhuvneshwar drops it beside his feet
back of a length and angling into middle, a crease-bound Bhuvneshwar squirts an inside edge onto the pad
short and outside off, chopped away to point
bouncer on middle, Bhuvneshwar ducks under it
flat, fast on middle and leg, Dhoni is on the back foot, whipping it away to deep midwicket
shorter and turns away outside off, pulled against the break to long-on. Bhuvneshwar gets off the mark after seven balls
Dhoni advances down the track, gets too close to the pitch to get any elevation, hit to long-on
Zampa errs in length. Offers up a full-toss on middle, Bhuvneshwar slog-sweeps it fiercely to the right of midwicket
flighted on off and turns away, pushed to point
tossed up outside off and breaks away further, tapped with the turn to point
wide of the crease, slow, short ball outside off, 111ks, Dhoni stabs it to point
first boundary for Dhoni. It comes off his 67th ball. Head-high short ball outside off, Dhoni hooks and top-edges it fine for a one-bounce four
full and outside off, presses forward and pushes to cover
full and swerving in on middle, nurdled off an inside edge wide of mid-on. Dhoni scampers across for the single
back of a length and outside off, flat-batted away to the cover-point sweeper
full and veering in on middle and leg, clipped away in the gap between long leg and deep square leg
Bhuvneshwar searches for a single, nearly ends up chopping it back onto the stumps. Back of a length on off, can't cut from there
Bhuvneshwar forays down the track, Stoinis drags his length back on middle, but Bhuvneshwar still flat-bats a pull straight of mid-on

offcutter, skids in on off, draws an lbw appeal as Bhuvneshwar aims to chop the ball square. Pad first? Not given on the field. Smith chooses to challenge the decision. Replays suggest bat first. Inside edge first, then onto the flap of the back pad. Umpire Anil Chaudhary's call is right
shoulder-high short ball on off, swatted away to deep square leg
slower bouncer, sails over the left shoulder of Dhoni, wide called
back of a length on off, Dhoni meets it with an open face and glides it to backward point
back of a length and outside off, Dhoni plays a jabbing punch to deep cover
full and speared into the pads, Dhoni glances a single down to long-on
back of a length and outside off, Bhuvneshwar clears his front leg and clobbers it straight of mid-on who was inside the circle
yorker, tinged with reverse swing, finishes on leg stump, Bhuvneshwar is beaten for pace. Squirts an inside edge to the fine leg boundary
overpitched and outside off, Bhuvneshwar creams it away to the right of the cover-point sweeper
change-up slower ball outside off, Bhuvneshwar waits for the ball to arrive, then glides it down to third man
wide yorker outside off, Dhoni can't dig it out
on a length and wide outside off, Bhuvneshwar slices it down to third man

just short of a good length and outside off, Dhoni jabs it away towards backward point. There is a brief moment of hesitation but Dhoni and Bhuvneshwar make it. Dhoni raises his bat and thrills the crowd - this is his 66th ODI fifty
back of a length and outside off, punched into the covers
short, wide outside off, 150ks, scythed to deep third man
back of a length and angled in on off, gently clipped to midwicket, gentle enough to earn two
back of a length on middle and leg, worked away through midwicket again
and he charges down the track, this is dug short on the leg stump, weak pull over midwicket
slower ball from the back of the hand, 114ks, dragged away through square leg
hip-high short ball on the leg stump, Dhoni sizes it up, picks it up with the wrists and launches it over short fine leg. Once-bounce four. Cheapuk goes: 'Dhoni!Dhoni!Dhoni!'
looks like the back of the hand slower delivery outside off, Dhoni has a big whooosh.... and misses
Dhoni surges down the track, Faulkner goes full and wide outside off. Dhoni extends his hands and scythes it over extra cover for a six. Stunning shot. Extra cover isn't really Dhoni's zone
Dhoni showing off his smarts. Anticipates the back-of-the-hand slower ball outside off, shuffles across off, takes a length ball from the stumps, and laps it away fine of the man in the deep
back of a length and zipping through outside off, Bhuvneshwar presses forward, swings.... and misses
middle-stump yorker, excellent ball, dug out
very full on middle, backs away outside leg and carves it through cover point
slower, back of a length and outside off, check-pushed to point
Bhuvneshwar slinks away outside the leg stump, the bowler chases him guided to third man. Dhoni pushes on for the second, Bhuvneshwar responds. Wade can't collect the throw from Faulkner cleanly
back of a length on middle, rushes onto Bhuvneshwar, 145ks, he is cramped up for a pull. Ends up splicing it in front of cover. The ball does not carry to Stoinis who was diving forward
slower, short ball on the leg stump, all Dhoni has to do is to pull it away to the fine-leg boundary. Well, well, it's a front-foot no-ball as well

Faulkner aims for a yorker, goes too full on the pads, Dhoni picks it up with his powerful wrists and whips it with the bottom hand over square leg. Coulter-Nile slides to his right and stops the ball. Dhoni did not even run

he doesn't need to run when he can launch it for sixes. This is vintage Dhoni and the crowd soaks it in. He surges down the track, meets a length ball outside off and lifts it imperiously over long-off
back-of-the-hand slower delivery outside off, Dhoni aims for a club over midwicket. No dice. Beaten

Dhoni forays down the track again... this time holes out to long-off. Faulkner's front foot is fine. Faulker pulled his length back, seeing Dhoni step out, on off stump. Dhoni gets it high on the bat and splices it to Warner for a head-high catch
Bhuvneshwar shuffled a long way across the off stump even before Faulkner delivered the ball. Length ball outside off, paddled away stylishly to the fine-leg boundary
back-of-the-hand slower ball outside off, Bhuvneshwar swings for the hills... and misses
back of a length, swinging in at the pads. Tucked to midwicket who is close in
back of a length, shaped in at middle stump. Defended off the back foot into the leg side
good length, swinging down leg side and past his attempted flick
back of a length, bending in at the thigh guard. Late to get his bat around and he awkwardly bunts it into the leg side
back of a length outside off, just angle this time, no swing. Pushed to point with an open face
slower ball, full outside off stump. Looks to clatter it through the off side but he's forced to check his drive. A knuckle ball from the bowler
back of a length at off stump, lifts off after pitching. Takes the thick outside edge but he was playing with soft hands. Dribbles backward of point and they run through
shot. Beautiful from Warner. This is overpitched on off stump. His front leg's out of the way but the bat comes down nice and straight. Punched past mid-off
back of a length on the pads, skids in quickly. Nudged off the inside edge to short fine, via thigh guard
back of a length at middle stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
lovely line. Good length and angled into the corridor. Late on this forward push as it straightens and zips past the outside edge
length and into the pads. Looks to tickle this fine, but he can only get pad on it. Dhoni collects down leg side. Feeble appeal is turned down
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the covers
slower ball, full and wide. Chases it with hard hands. Can only slice it to deep point. Uppish, but safe
narrowly misses the off stump. Superb seam presentation. Good length, in at off stump and just flies through from above as Cartwright offers a big gap between bat and pad on his push
outside edge falls short of slip. Length and swinging away from the corridor. Wafts at it on the up and gets a big edge that lands to Rohit Sharma's right. He parries it towards third man
length and swinging into the pads. Warner leaps to smother the bounce and whips it well to the left of deep square. Used his wrists and timed that perfectly
full and swinging away from middle. Whips against the angle, straight to midwicket
back of a length, swinging into his mid-riff. Bit of theatrics from Warner in his stance. But he can't tuck this past midwicket who hares to his right after Warner pushed towards mid-on

offcutter, good length and in at off stump. Cops him in the back thigh as he stretches forward. Didn't pick that slower one. They scamper through and he has half-collapsed. Perhaps that was a little right of the inner thigh
another slower one. This one spits off a length outside off. Shoulder of the bat and into the off side as he fends in front
back of a length at off stump, pushes too hard as he looks to steal a single in the off side
good length at middle stump, tapped wide of mid-on off the back foot

bowled him! Bumrah's length is tough to pick for most, let alone a debutant. He sits on the back foot. And swipes across the line on length. It's just short of good length and skids through, as it does for Bumrah. Just above knee height and into the off stump
short and wide, slashes hard at it. It bounces rapidly over the outside edge
back of a length in the corridor, pulled off the toe-end to long-on
back of a length in the corridor, pushed to point off the back foot
back of a length outside off, turned to deep square off the back foot
in the air but he's safe. It's a slower ball, climbing on him from a length at off stump. He goes across the line but has to check his shot. Manages to chip it over midwicket

strikes him on the pads and he's on the back foot trying to shovel this into the leg side. Loud appeal. It hit him on the knee roll. No problem on height for sure. Deep in the crease. They've reviewed. Well, I'd make a terrible umpire. It hit him in line, but that was probably going over. Umpire's call. He survives

out the next ball! If you think Bumrah's bowling action is queer, you should see this catch! This is a length ball, on middle stump. Straightens and climbs as he looks to flick this into the leg side. It's a top edge that flies over Bumrah at short fine leg. He runs backwards in pursuit...only to realise he has overdone it. By the time it comes down, he's facing the crowd. Extraordinarily, he arches backwards, puts up a reverse-cup and follows this swerving ball to hold on. As if the ball from the crowd! Stunning
good length, spins back in at off stump. Stretches forward and pokes it back. Extra cover dives to his left to field
short and wide, spins away a long way. Toe-ended cut to sweeper
good length at middle stump, reverse sweep, straight to point
good length at leg stump, tucked into the open square leg region off the back foot
back of a length outside off, cut past backward point and to sweeper's right
tossed up at middle stump, driven firmly to long-on
slower ball, full at middle stump. Driven to sweeper with an open face
back of a length into the pads. An offcutter. Whipped uppishly to deep square's left

slower ball, short at middle stump. Looks to parry it past short fine but he's got a leading edge that lands in front of Kuldeep. He's too keen on the run out and is shaping to throw before gathering it. Fumbles and lets them through

caught behind. Offcutters, slower ball, knuckle balls. Australia have not been able to get themselves in at all. This is a knuckle ball pushed wide, back of a length. Head has plenty of room. But he's early on the shot. Swings hard and gets an outside edge that lobs harmlessly through to Dhoni - almost dipping on him - and he completes a simple take
back of a length at off stump. MAxwell already skipping leg side to make room. Slashes this hard, straight to sweeper cover
another offcutter, good length and on the pads. Flicked past short fine's dive. Deep backward square keeps it to one
back of a length at leg stump, pushed through square leg off the back foot

incredible shot. This is full, almost an overpitched one at middle. But he middles the sweep after getting right down. Gets it past square leg. Deep midwicket runs 20 yards to his left and slides to save the boundary
full at middle stump, jammed out to midwicket
wrong'un, good length at off stump. Deflected off the inside half of the bat as he pushes forward at this
didn't pick it. On the back foot to this length ball at off stump. Spins away as he pokes at it

good catch! It's a slider from Kuldeep. After the slow one that turns away from the corridor. This is straight through at the same line. Warner goes for the cut and gets a big outside edge. Dhoni takes a sharp one that nearly slides out of his gloves. A slight juggle to hold on to it. Kuldeep is ecstatic. Warner, less so.
144 kph. That was quick from Pandya. Maxwell was backing away early, so he followed him with a bouncer. Too quick to even attempt the shot. A stare from Pandya to cap it all
yorker at middle stump. Inside edge, onto pad and straight to mid-on via the bowler's fingertips
lands wide of mid-on who was backpedalling. Good length ball, slow and outside off. Looks to slice it over extra cover but it's off the toe and lobbed over the umpire. Pandey can't get to it
well played. Shuffles around, camps in the crease and waits for the shot ball to come to him. Third man is in and he slices this over him
whack. Some force on that from Maxwell. Old-fashioned slog after setting up deep in his crease. Midwicket was in and he picked this slower ball from outside off and slapped it past him
knuckle ball. Dug in short. He backs away to try and slap this behind square on the off side, but the change in pace does him. Beaten
short one on the leg stump. Looks to force it off the back foot, awkwardly. It lands pitch side on the off side off the leading edge

a stumping referral to the third umpire. This one was outside off at a length. Spun away rapidly as he pushed right forward. His leg is in the air...but in the next frame, as Dhoni flicks the bails off, it has landed. He's safe.
no idea, Stoinis. Walks across to the off side. Not sure whether to go forward or back. Stuck in between. Awkward poke and he's trapped on the pad. HE was outside the line
full and fast at middle stump and he goes for the sweep. Just manages to get bat. Just. Turned to short fine
length at middle stump, forward block
tossed up outside off, driven past extra cover and wide of long-off. Back for the second
good length, outside off stump. Switches to a left-handed grip and tries to waft this over backward point. Cops it in the body.
short and spinning down leg. Pin drop silence as the crowd see Maxwell swivel and launch this over short fine. One bounce, into the long leg boundary
good length at middle stump, not to the pitch with the slog sweep but he goes through. Gets under it, and lifts it over the midwicket boundary
oh, so clean! What a striker of the ball. This is in his slot. Nicely looped full at middle stump. A short stride to get to the pitch and clobbered flat into the sightscreen
uff! This is what they pay him for. Full one on leg stump. Slightly flat but he's down quickly. On one knee. Lifts it cleanly over the square leg boundary
back of a length, wrong'un. Spins past his attempted switch-hit. He's beaten outside off
makes room early. This is full on middle stump. He slices it to sweeper cover
full on leg stump. He goes for the sweep and it flies to square leg. Appears to be a bump ball. And the soft signal is not out as he goes upstairs...not out.
full outside off, down the track to drive through the off side. Mistimes it. Straight back at the bowler
full outside off, misses the reverse sweep. An emphatic, wild reverse sweep attempt
ohhhhh yesss. Pushed through at leg stump. Down on one knee again. It's so close to him but he gets under and launches it over square leg

holes out to long-on! Tossed up wide outside off. The perfect place for someone slogging across the line. On length, it's still hittable. But it's also turning away. He gets it off the toe and straight to the fielder. Chahal holds up his arms like everything was planned.
tossed up at off stump. Wrong'un. He's beaten and Dhoni has missed the ball and the stumping. Stoinis was outside
good length at middle stump, spins into his mid-riff as he pushes forward
wrong'un. Good length outside off. Crouches early to set up for the slog sweep. But again, it's spinning away. He lifts it high towards deep midwicket and Jadeja takes it cleanly
full toss at leg stump, tickled straight to short fine
full at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
wrong'un, strikes him in front of off. He didn't pick that on the front foot. Not out says the umpire. May have been going over. There was also the sound of an inside edge
Chahal lobs up a middle-stump full-toss, Faulkner flicks the ball out to deep midwicket

Chahal has dropped a return catch! It wasn't an easy chance. Wade forays down the track, takes it on the full and drives it back to the bowler. Chahal sticks out his right hand but the ball does not stick. Not even on the rebound
tossed outside off, Wade runs down the track again, slugs it away to the left of Pandya at deep midwicket
pushed through flatter and faster, starts outside leg and spins in to beat the sweep and rap the front pad. The lbw appeal is shot down
looks like a googly, turning away from Wade outside off, he slogs at it and the edge swirls to where short third man may have been
quickish slider, too full, Faulkner goes low for a slog sweep but is struck on the pad
full and sliding down leg, glanced easily to long leg
yorker just a shade outside off, jammed out through cover-point
full on the pads, whipped away wide of deep midwicket. Faulkner hustles back for the second
just short of a good length and outside off, Faulkner chops it hard to deep point
full cutter, floats down the leg side as Wade falls over a paddle sweep. Leg-side wide

Wade is hit on the grille of the helmet. Slower, short ball on leg stump, Wade is through with the hook. Ricochets into the helmet off the arm. India have been excellent with their cutters and slower balls
hip-high short ball outside off, which is shovel-pulled away to square leg
really full and wide outside off, the batsman backs away outside leg and flat-bats it back to the bowler

Chahal drops another catch off his own bowling. Tossed outside off, grips, and turns away. The batsman eyes up a swipe across the line, against the turn. The ball balloons to the left of Chahal. He runs to his left, gets both his hands onto the ball, but can't cling on to this edge

Wade steps down the track and flashes hard, Chahal drags his length back outside off and darts it wide outside off, well past the batsman's reach. Dhoni collects it and whips the bails off. Chepauk raises itself to a big roar again. More questions over Wade after a poor series with the bat in Bangladesh
length-ball googly, breaks back in and bounces over off, Cummins aims to hit down the ground. No dice
regulation legbreak outside off, slashes and sends a thick outside edge past slip
Rahane runs in from long-off and drops it. Tossed up on middle, Faulkner backs away outside leg and lofts it to long-off, where Rahane shells it
pushed through outside off, Faulkner drags a slog-sweep from outside off to deep midwicket
Faulkner uses his feet, shorter on middle, punched to long-on. Pandey runs in and fumbles. The result is three
shortish on middle, flat-batted right back to the bowler, who takes some pace off the ball. It rolls down to long-on
really, really full on the leg stump, Faulkner squirts an inside edge to square leg
shortish and outside off, powerfully heaved across the line to the right of deep midwicket. Cummins can smack it alright but is this beyond Australia
backs away outside leg, meets a short ball and crisply forces it to the sweeper
full on off, possibly a slower ball, as Faulkner swats it across the line to deep midwicket

The asking rate has ballooned. Cummins aims to prick the balloon with a slog over midwicket, against the break. But a top edge balloons to short third man. It started on middle and turned away to claim the edge
tossed-up legbreak outside off, Faulkner clears his front leg and clatters it into the sightscreen. Lofted straight down the ground
faster and flatter on off, shovel-pulled away to deep midwicket
flat dart on off, whipped out to deep midwicket
skidding into leg stump, beats the flick, and raps the pad
legbreak, starts outside off and spins away, slugged away to deep midwicket
just short of a good length and outside off, Faulkner throws his bat at the ball and sends a thick outside edge through where slip may have been
Bumrah searches for the yorker, misses his length and offers up a full-toss on off, which is belted ram-rod straight down the ground, so much so it strikes the stumps at the non-striker's end
The batsman moves away outside leg but Bumrah still troubles him with a yorker, jammed out for one
full-toss on off, punched down to long-on. The call from Faulker is for two but Australia have to settle with just one
change-up slower ball outside off, 109ks offcutter, NCN swings early... and misses
another one, slower, fuller, wider outside off. Coulter-Nile does not spot the lack of pace. He slogs way too early
middle-stump yorker, dragged to long-on off the toe end
wide of the crease and floated very wide outside off, well past the guideline, off-side wide

Heaved flat and hard to Jadhav at deep midwicket. Good length slower one at 114ks, not sure if that was a knuckle ball. Coulter-Nile can't clear the man in the deep. Rohit gives Jadhav a leaping high-five
full and straight on middle, drilled down to long-off
off-stump yorker, squeezed out
full and wide outside off, scythed away through the covers
back of a length and outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
very full and the exaggerated angle makes things difficult for Faulkner. Flicked away through midwicket. Faulkner farms the strike

Faulkner extends his hands, slashes, and edges it behind. The ball dips on Dhoni who dives forward and gloves the ball. But he isn't sure if it's a clean catch. He has a wry smile. The soft signal from umpire Erasmus is out. They go to the TV umpire. Nope, Dhoni has grassed it
slower short ball outside off, past the wild swing, off-side wide
really, really full on off, not a perfect yorker, squeezed down to long-on. There is a mix-up between the wickets. The throw from the deep, though, hits Faulkner on his back side
full and wide outside off, 109ks, Zampa slices it in the air, Jadhav races in from sweeper cover but the ball drops short of him
dug short and outside off, another slower ball, swatted to long-on

Bumrah nails a yorker on middle, squirted away to short fine leg. That is that. India win the series opener by 26 runs (D/L method). This is Australia's ninth successive ODI loss on the road, in completed matches
